column4: yea i saw that earlier Evanlec, skimmed through it, bookmarked it, its more of a thing ill read in class lol
you don't have to do that.  You just tell the installer not to format the partition in gparted
not if he wants a fresh install
i do it all the time, what do u mean?  You setup the partitions you setup your /home to be mounted, just not formated.  That way all the data in the /home partition is in tact.
if his /home dir isnt on a seperate partition
well then how can you unmount it?  You're the one who said that
u mount the original root partition, and delete all the other dirs /bin /etc /sys ... and then unmount it and start the install without formatting
oh i see.  didn't realize /home wasn't on a seperate partition.  But yah in that case i'd go one more step and create another partition and copy /home to it then format over everything.. :)
yea, well i didnt know if his /home dir was on a different partition anyways, and i forgot who was asking too lol
